Event.name: Light_movement
Event.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Emitter</fen> emits a <fen>Beam</fen> of light from a <fen>Source</fen>, along a <fen>Path</fen>, and/or towards a <fen>Goal</fen>. Essentially, this frame denotes the (semi-)fictive motion of the the <fen>Beam</fen>. <ex>Avoid allowing <fex name="Beam">light</fex> to <t>shine</t> <fex name="Goal">into neighbors' gardens</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Beam">Clear yellow sunlight</fex> <t>shone</t> <fex name="Path">through the window-panes</fex>.</ex> <ex>She thinks <fex name="Emit">the sun</fex> <t>shines</t> <fex name="Src">out of his backside</fex>.</ex> <ex>...when <fex name="Emit">the candles</fex> <t>shine</t> <fex name="Src">out</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Beam">It</fex> <t>shines</t> <fex name="Goal">in my eyes</fex>. ('It' is both Beam and Emitter, though only one will show up in the display.) </ex> <ex>...<fex name="Beam">light</fex> <t>shines</t> <fex name="Path">down</fex> <fex name="Goal">on the world</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Beam">The moonlight</fex> <t>shone</t> <fex name="Path">off the fields</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Beam">The candlelight</fex> <t>glinted</t> <fex name="Src">from pearls and rubies</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>Degree to which the light movement occurs</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>Depictive phrase describing the external argument. <ex>Their swords <t>glowed</t> <fex name="Depictive">red</fex> in the setting sun.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Emitter
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the entity at the <fen>Source</fen> from which the <fen>Beam</fen> originates.</def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Beam</fen> occupies initially before its change of location.</def-root>

Arg.name: Beam
Arg.definition: <def-root>The light that travels from a <fen>Source</fen> along a <fen>Path</fen> to a <fen>Goal</fen>. <ex><fex name="Beam">Sunlight</fex> <t>gleamed</t> from the water of the bay.</ex> <ex><fex name="Beam">Lamplight</fex> <t>flickered</t> through the foggy air.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Path</fen> refers to where the <fen>Beam</fen> travels over or to a landmark the <fen>Beam</fen> travels by.</def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Beam</fen> ends up in.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: glow.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to give forth steady light, reflected from light which fills an area.

lexUnit.name: twinkle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to illuminate an object by shining with a gleam that changes constantly from bright to faint.

lexUnit.name: twinkle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a twinkling sparkle or gleam.

lexUnit.name: sparkle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shine brightly with flashes of light.

lexUnit.name: shine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give out a bright light

lexUnit.name: shine.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a glow of bright light

lexUnit.name: shimmer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shine with a soft tremulous light.

lexUnit.name: sheen.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a soft lustre on a surface.

lexUnit.name: scintillation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a flash of light.

lexUnit.name: scintillate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to emit flashes of light

lexUnit.name: refulgence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a very bright shine.

lexUnit.name: glow.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a steady radiance of light

lexUnit.name: glitter.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to shine with a shimmering light

lexUnit.name: glitter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a bright, shimmering reflected light.

lexUnit.name: glister.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to emit a sparkle

lexUnit.name: glister.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sparkle.

lexUnit.name: glistening.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: giving off a sparkle as on something wet.

lexUnit.name: glisten.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shine or sparkle (as on something wet or moist)

lexUnit.name: glint.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give out or reflect small flashes of light.

lexUnit.name: glint.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small flash of light, especially a reflected one.

lexUnit.name: glimmer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shine faintly with a wavering light.

lexUnit.name: glimmer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a faint or wavering light.

lexUnit.name: gleam.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to shine brightly (as a light source)

lexUnit.name: gleam.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an emission of a faint or brief light

lexUnit.name: flicker.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to emit light unsteadily, intermittently

lexUnit.name: flicker.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the emission of light unsteadily from a source

lexUnit.name: flash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shine or cause to shine in a bright but brief, sudden, or intermittent way.

lexUnit.name: flash.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a sudden brief burst of light

lexUnit.name: flare.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to emit light with a sudden intensity, as of that emitted from a sudden fire

lexUnit.name: flame.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to emit light as of that from a fire

lexUnit.name: coruscation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: flash or sparkle.

lexUnit.name: coruscate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: emitting a flash or sparkle from a light source

lexUnit.name: strike.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: become illuminated by a source of light
